page.title: 11MARKET SURVEY
page.content: THE SURVEY WAS CARRIED OUT OVER A TWO WEEK PERIOD WITH THE FOLLOWING RESULTS: FOUR TIMES AS MANY WOMEN THAN MEN WERE INTERVIEWED AT THE MARKET;{46%}OF THE PEOPLE STAYED LESS THAN HALF AN HOUR;{18%}STAYED FOR MORE THAN 1 HOUR; {40%}OF THE SHOPPERS SPENT MORE THAN Â£5;WHILST{33%}SPENT BETWEEN Â£1_Â£3;{68% VISITED THE MARKET EVERY WEEK;{18% CAME EVERY MONTH;{60%}WALKED TO THE MARKET;{6%}ARRIVED BY TRAIN. MOST SHOPPERS CAME FOR A GENERAL VISIT RATHER THAN ANY PARTICULAR COMMODITY. THEY THOUGHT IT COULD BE IMPROVED BY EXTRA STALLS, WHILST STALLHOLDERS SAID THEY WOULD PREFER A LARGER SITE.
